questions.question_text:
As part of the 'authorize a work package' activity, the project manager is preparing the work package for the marketing materials. The project manager has asked the team manager for this work package to draft some specialist sections of the work package. The project manager and project assurance will review these sections before the work package is authorized.
Is this an appropriate action, and why?

choices.C: No, because the project manager should produce the work package as part of the 'authorize a work package' activity
choices.A: Yes, because project assurance is responsible for the work package being correctly authorized
choices.B: Yes, because the project manager is responsible for authorizing the work package even if its preparation is delegated
choices.D: No, because the team manager should approve the work package once authorized by the project manager

discussion.content:
A

n the PRINCE2 project management methodology, the executive is part of the project board along with the senior user and senior supplier. While the senior user is responsible for specifying the needs of those who will use the project’s products, and the senior supplier represents those designing, developing, facilitating, procuring, and implementing the products, it is ultimately the executive who is accountable for the success of the project. This includes approving changes to forecasts or plans that impact the project’s business case, such as a revised sales forecast.

However, it’s important to note that in practice, these roles can collaborate and make decisions together. But from a responsibility and accountability perspective in PRINCE2, it’s the executive’s role to approve such changes. So, even considering options B and C, option A remains the most appropriate answer.
